items.q: Which African country is the most populous on the entire continent?
items.explanation: Nigeria has a rapidly growing population that far exceeds any other nation in Africa.

items.q: Mount Kilimanjaro is the tallest mountain physically located in South America.
items.explanation: Mount Kilimanjaro is the tallest mountain in Africa (Tanzania). Aconcagua is the tallest in South America.

items.q: The country of Turkey is situated geographically in both Europe and Asia.
items.explanation: Turkey is a transcontinental country, with a small portion (East Thrace) in Southeast Europe.

items.q: What is the physical definition of a 'fjord'?
items.a: A fjord is a long, narrow, incredibly deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs, typically formed by submergence of a glaciated valley.
items.explanation: Norway and New Zealand are immensely famous for their fjords.

items.q: Name the profoundly arid desert region located in northern Chile that is considered the driest non-polar desert in the world.
items.explanation: Some weather stations in the Atacama have never reliably received a single drop of rain.

items.q: Which two European nations fundamentally share the island of Hispaniola in the Caribbean?
items.explanation: They are the only two sovereign nations occupying that specific island.

items.q: What is the capital city of the vast, landlocked central Asian country of Mongolia?
items.explanation: It is historically known as one of the coldest capital cities in the world.

items.q: Explain what the 'Continental Divide' of the Americas means geographically.
items.a: It is the principal, largely mountainous hydrological divide of the Americas.
items.explanation: In North America, it functionally runs along the crest of the Rocky Mountains.

items.q: What incredibly small island nation in the Mediterranean Sea lies fundamentally between Sicily and the North African coast?
items.explanation: It is a fiercely independent microstate boasting immense historical and strategic maritime importance.

items.q: Which colossal mountain range physically separates the harshly cold Indian subcontinent from the Tibetan Plateau?
items.explanation: They contain many of Earth's highest peaks, including Mount Everest.
